title: Oyster Mushrooms with Sausage
introduction: This hearty dish combines the delicate flavor of oyster mushrooms with the savory goodness of Italian sweet pork sausages. Perfectly seasoned with garlic, shallots, and a hint of crushed red pepper, this recipe is a tribute to traditional Italian cooking, made even better with a touch of fresh, chopped tomatoes. Whether served as a side dish with crusty Italian bread or as a main course, this dish is sure to delight.
ingredients: 8 ounces Italian sweet pork sausages, casings removed
1 cup peeled, seeded, and chopped fresh tomatoes

instructions.description: Wipe the mushrooms with dampened paper towels. Tear the mushrooms into thin strips along the gills.
Pour the oil into a large skillet. Add the garlic and shallots and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in the sausage and cook, stirring frequently, until browned.
Add mushrooms, salt to taste, and crushed red pepper and stir well. Add the tomatoes and 1/4 cup of water. Bring to a simmer.
Turn the heat to low and cover the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, 30 minutes or until the sausage is tender and the sauce is thickened. Serve hot.

variations.variation: Cultivated oyster mushrooms can be used in this recipe, or substitute sliced white mushrooms.
